criteria: Applying Multiplication and Division to Rational Numbers
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of rational numbers or their representation.
Student can identify integers but struggles with representing fractions as rational numbers.
Student can represent simple fractions as rational numbers but struggles with negative fractions and complex quotients.
Student understands that integers can be divided (except by zero) and represented as rational numbers but struggles to explain the relationship between -(p/q), (-p)/q, and p/(-q).
Student demonstrates a solid understanding of representing integers and fractions as rational numbers. Student explains the equivalence of -(p/q), (-p)/q, and p/(-q).

Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of rational numbers. Student clearly explains and justifies the equivalence of different representations of negative rational numbers (-(p/q), (-p)/q, and p/(-q)).
Student is unable to perform multiplication or division with rational numbers.
Student can perform multiplication and division with simple positive rational numbers but struggles with negative numbers and fractions.
Student can perform multiplication and division with positive and negative rational numbers but makes frequent errors in calculations.
Student can perform multiplication and division with rational numbers but struggles with complex problems involving multiple operations.
Student accurately performs multiplication and division with rational numbers, including complex problems. Student can estimate the relative size of numbers.
Student demonstrates fluency and accuracy in multiplying and dividing rational numbers, including complex problems with multiple operations. Student shows estimation skills.
Student cannot interpret quotients of rational numbers in real-world contexts.
Student attempts to interpret quotients but provides inaccurate or nonsensical explanations.
Student can interpret simple quotients in real-world contexts but struggles with negative numbers and complex scenarios.
Student interprets quotients of rational numbers in real-world contexts but struggles to provide clear and accurate explanations.
Student provides accurate and relevant interpretations of quotients of rational numbers in various real-world contexts. Student can verbalize the impact of dividing by various numbers.
Student demonstrates a deep understanding of quotients of rational numbers and can provide insightful and nuanced interpretations in complex real-world contexts. Student can create novel examples.
